lessons.japanese: 興奮した観客はコンサートホールになだれこんだ。
lessons.english: The excited audience ran into the concert hall.

lessons.japanese: 委員会は別のホールに会場を移した。
lessons.english: The committee adjourned to another hall.

lessons.japanese: ママと私はホールに逃げたのよ。
lessons.english: Mummy and I moved into the hall.

lessons.japanese: ホールをきれいに掃除しておかなければならない。
lessons.english: It is necessary that the halls be well cleaned.
The hall was filled to capacity.

lessons.japanese: ホールはキャパ一杯だった。
lessons.english: The hall was filled to capacity.

lessons.japanese: ホールは仕切りを設ける前は千人収容できた。
lessons.english: The hall could seat a thousand people before it was partitioned.

lessons.japanese: ホールのいすの数は８０です。
lessons.english: The number of the chairs in the hall is 80.

lessons.japanese: ホールに入りきれないほど客がきた。
lessons.english: More guests have come than the hall can hold.
There's a telephone in the hall.

lessons.japanese: ホールには聴衆が大勢いた。
lessons.english: There was a large crowd in the hall.

lessons.japanese: ホールには聴衆はあまりいなかった。
lessons.english: There was a small audience in the hall.

lessons.japanese: ホールには人がいっぱいいた。
lessons.english: There were many people in the hall.

lessons.japanese: ホールには空席は一つもなかった。
lessons.english: There wasn't a single vacant seat in the hall.
